title: How does Bluetooth Work?
description: Bluetooth technology works by allowing devices to communicate wirelessly over short distances using radio waves. It uses a specific frequency range to transmit data between devices such as smartphones, laptops, headphones, speakers, and more. When two Bluetooth-enabled devices come within range of each other, they establish a connection and can then transfer data back and forth. This enables features like wireless audio streaming, file sharing, and connection to peripherals like keyboards and mice. The technology is named after Harald Bluetooth, a Viking king known for uniting tribes, symbolizing how Bluetooth technology unites different devices to work together seamlessly.
comments: Bluetooth technology operates through short-range radio waves that connect devices together to enable wireless communication. It works by establishing a secure connection between devices using Bluetooth protocols.
